item.title: Police find body 'consistent with' Gabby Petito in Wyoming
item.description: Crews searching a national park in Wyoming for missing Gabby Petito found a body "consistent" with the 22-year-old woman in a remote area on Sunday but have not yet made a formal identification, the FBI said.

item.title: Philippines approves limited face-to-face classes
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte has approved the conduct of limited face-to-face classes in areas with minimal risk of COVID-19 infection, Malacañang and Education Secretary Leonor Briones announced on Monday.

item.title: DOH: 319 new Delta cases detected, variant now most common lineage
item.description: The Department of Health said Monday that the highly transmissible Delta variant of the coronavirus is now the most common lineage among sequenced samples of COVID-19 cases in the Philippines.

item.title: OCTA reiterates COVID-19 cases in NCR may have peaked; DOH says not yet
item.description: The rise in COVID-19 cases in the National Capital Region may have already peaked, independent expert group OCTA Research reiterated on Monday.

item.title: House leader seeks abolition of DBM-PS
item.description: Deputy Speaker Rufus Rodriguez is seeking for the abolition of the Department of Budget and Management's Procurement Service (DBM-PS), the office currently at the center of congressional investigations on allegedly questionable purchases of medical supplies.

item.title: Isko Moreno confirms meeting with Robredo, Pacquiao ahead of Eleksyon 2022 filing of candidacy
item.description: Manila Mayor Isko Moreno on Monday confirmed that he had a meeting with Vice President Leni Robredo and Senator Manny Pacquiao ahead of the filing of candidacy in October for Eleksyon 2022.

item.title: Ex-ICC judge: Public, social media statements can be used as evidence in ICC drug war probe
item.description: Public statements of Philippine government officials, including those made on social media, are admissible evidence before the International Criminal Court (ICC), retired ICC judge Raul Pangalangan said Monday.

item.title: Edgar Erice leaves Liberal Party in favor of Aksyon Demokratiko
item.description: After 18 years, Caloocan City Representative Edgar Erice on Monday decided to leave the Liberal Party as he transfers to the Aksyon Demokratiko.

item.title: CHR in favor of prioritizing healthcare workers for COVID-19 booster shots
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights on Monday said it is supporting vaccine czar Carlito Galvez's statement last week that healthcare workers should be prioritized in the administration of COVID-19 booster shots.

item.title: Military aircraft crashes into Texas residential area
item.description: A military training aircraft crashed on Sunday in a residential neighborhood of Lake Worth, Texas, injuring at least two and damaging homes, authorities said.

item.title: Stockpiled COVID vaccines must be handed to poorer nations, says former UK PM
item.description: A vaccine summit being hosted by US President Joe Biden must come up with a plan this week to transfer 100 million stockpiled COVID-19 vaccines to poorer countries before they reach their expiry date, former British Prime Minister Gordon Brown said.

item.title: Pateros mayor sees no discrimination, human rights violation in yellow ribbons for COVID-positive houses
item.description: Pateros Mayor Miguel "Ike" Ponce III on Monday said he sees no discrimination or human rights violation in having yellow ribbons placed in front of houses with COVID-19 cases in the municipality.

item.title: No DOH recommendation yet regarding COVID-19 jabs for minors --Vergeire
item.description: There is no recommendation yet from the Department of Health (DOH) regarding the vaccination of individuals 12 to 17 years old against COVID-19, Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said Monday.

item.title: Mga kaso ng COVID-19 sa Camarines Norte, tumaas pa; provincial hospital isolation ward, puno na
item.description: Umakyat na sa 2,280 ang bilang ng mga tinamaan ng COVID-19 sa lalawigan ng Camarines Norte nitong Sabado, ayon sa datos ng Department of Health Bicol Center for Health Development.

item.title: World leaders return to UN this week with focus on pandemic, climate
item.description: World leaders are returning to the United Nations in New York this week with a focus on boosting efforts to fight both climate change and the COVID-19 pandemic, which last year forced them to send video statements for the annual gathering.
